newsitem.title: CANADA: Arthurs-Jones to acquire Jay Packaging.
newsitem.headline: Arthurs-Jones to acquire Jay Packaging.

text.p: Arthurs-Jones Inc said on Monday it entered into a binding agreement to acquire, together with management, all of the shares of Jay Packaging Group Inc for about C$24 million, including debt assumption.
Arthurs-Jones said "substantially all" of the purchase price is to be funded by debt that is non-recourse to Arthurs-Jones.
The deal is slated to close by about January 31, 1997.
On closing, 65-percent of Jay will be owned by Arthurs-Jones, with the balance held by five members of Jay's senior management.
Arthurs-Jones said the investment in Jay will strengthen Arthurs-Jones' position as a North American leader in producting printing and packaging products.

In the year ended March 31, 1996 Jay had net sales of C$38 million and earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation of C$5.2 million. As of December 31, 1996 Jay's nine month net sales of C$31 million and EBITD of C$5.6 million indicate that Jay is on target to record performance, Arthurs-Jones said.
